metadata.validation: SRS-aware with placeholder blocking and deduplication

phase1_test_cases.test_title: New user registration with valid username
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a new user can register successfully using a unique and valid username.
preconditions: Browser is open and connected to the internet
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter 'newuser123' in the username field
Step 3: Enter a valid email address 'newuser@example.com' in the email field
Step 4: Enter a strong password 'SecurePass123!' in the password field
Step 5: Click the 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User registration is successful, and a confirmation message 'Registration successful. Please check your email for verification.' appears on the screen.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Attempt to register with an already used username
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that attempting to register with a username that is already in use results in an appropriate error message.
preconditions: Browser is open and connected to the internet
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter 'existinguser' in the username field
Step 3: Enter a valid email address 'newemail@example.com' in the email field
Step 4: Enter a strong password 'SecurePass123!' in the password field
Step 5: Click the 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An error message 'Username already exists. Please choose a different username.' is displayed, preventing the user from registering with an existing username.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Register with a maximum allowed character length for username
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows registration with a username of the maximum allowed character length.
preconditions: Browser is open and connected to the internet
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter 'a' repeated 30 times in the username field (e.g., 'aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa')
Step 3: Enter a valid email address 'longusername@example.com' in the email field
Step 4: Enter a strong password 'SecurePass123!' in the password field
Step 5: Click the 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User registration is successful with a username of maximum allowed length, and the system displays 'Registration successful. Please check your email for verification.' message.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Register a new user and verify email confirmation process
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that after registering, the system sends an email for verification and allows login only upon successful verification.
preconditions: Browser is open and connected to the internet
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter 'newuser456' in the username field
Step 3: Enter a valid email address 'verifyemail@example.com' in the email field
Step 4: Enter a strong password 'SecurePass123!' in the password field
Step 5: Click the 'Register' button
Step 6: Check the inbox of 'verifyemail@example.com' for an email with verification link
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An email is sent to 'verifyemail@example.com' containing a verification link. Upon clicking the link, user registration status changes to verified and login is successful.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Successful user login and redirection to dashboard
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a valid user can log in successfully and is redirected to the appropriate role-specific dashboard.
preconditions: User account exists with valid credentials
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to login page at /login
Step 2: Enter username 'john.doe@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass123!' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Login' button
Step 5: Verify redirect to dashboard at /dashboard
Step 6: Confirm JWT token present in Authorization header
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully logged in and redirected to dashboard with JWT token in response header

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Invalid user login credentials
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that an invalid username or password results in a failed login attempt and appropriate error message.
preconditions: User account exists with valid credentials
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to login page at /login
Step 2: Enter incorrect username 'wronguser@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'IncorrectPass!' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Login' button
Step 5: Verify error message 'Invalid credentials' displayed on login page
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Error message 'Invalid credentials' is displayed and user remains on the login page without redirection to dashboard

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Login with minimum password length requirement
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a user can log in with the minimum allowed password length.
preconditions: User account exists with valid credentials
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to login page at /login
Step 2: Enter username 'alice.smith@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter minimum length password 'Pass1!' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Login' button
Step 5: Verify redirect to dashboard at /dashboard
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully logs in with minimum password length and is redirected to the appropriate role-specific dashboard

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Login followed by access control check
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that after a successful login, the system performs an access control check to ensure the user is redirected to their role-specific dashboard.
preconditions: User account exists with valid credentials
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to login page at /login
Step 2: Enter username 'admin.user@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'AdminPass123!' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Login' button
Step 5: Verify redirect to admin dashboard at /admin/dashboard
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully logs in and is redirected to the role-specific admin dashboard after access control check

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User successfully establishes account with valid credentials and profile information
phase1_test_cases.description: Validates that a user can establish an account using the correct email, password, and additional profile details as specified.
preconditions: No existing user with same email
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter email 'newuser@example.com' in the Email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass456!' in the Password field
Step 4: Confirm password 'SecurePass456!' in the Confirm Password field
Step 5: Select 'Developer' as User Type from dropdown menu
Step 6: Click 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully registers and is redirected to the dashboard with a message 'Welcome, newuser@example.com!' displayed.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration fails due to invalid email format
phase1_test_cases.description: Validates that the system prevents user registration with an incorrectly formatted email address.
preconditions: No existing user with same email
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter email 'invalidemail' in the Email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass456!' in the Password field
Step 4: Confirm password 'SecurePass456!' in the Confirm Password field
Step 5: Select 'Developer' as User Type from dropdown menu
Step 6: Click 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Registration fails with an error message 'Invalid email format. Please enter a valid email address.' displayed.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration fails due to maximum allowed user limit reached
phase1_test_cases.description: Validates that the system prevents further registrations when the maximum number of users is already registered.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter email 'newuser@example.com' in the Email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass456!' in the Password field
Step 4: Confirm password 'SecurePass456!' in the Confirm Password field
Step 5: Select 'Developer' as User Type from dropdown menu
Step 6: Click 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Registration fails with an error message 'User limit reached. Please contact support for assistance.' displayed.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration triggers email verification process
phase1_test_cases.description: Validates that upon successful user registration, an email verification link is sent to the registered email address.
preconditions: No existing user with same email
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to registration page at /register
Step 2: Enter email 'newuser@example.com' in the Email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass456!' in the Password field
Step 4: Confirm password 'SecurePass456!' in the Confirm Password field
Step 5: Select 'Developer' as User Type from dropdown menu
Step 6: Click 'Register' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully registers and an email verification link is sent to 'newuser@example.com' with a message 'Please verify your account by clicking the link in the email.'

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User can persist task in MySQL and view it only when logged in
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a user can create a new task which is stored in the database and visible only to them upon login.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /login page
Step 2: Enter username 'user@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass123' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Login' button
Step 5: Navigate to task creation page at /tasks/new
Step 6: Enter task name 'Test Task' and description 'This is a test task'
Step 7: Click 'Create Task' button
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully creates a new task which appears in their dashboard upon login and not visible to other users.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Unauthorized user cannot view or modify another user's task
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a logged-in user cannot access tasks created by other users.
preconditions: Task creation successful for another user
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /login page as 'user@example.com'
Step 2: Enter password 'SecurePass123' in password field
Step 3: Click 'Login' button
Step 4: Attempt to navigate to another user's task URL '/tasks/other_user_task_id'
Step 5: Verify that the system redirects back to the dashboard or displays an error message
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User is redirected to their own task list and cannot view another user's tasks.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Task visibility when multiple users are logged in simultaneously
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a task created by one user is not visible to other concurrently logged-in users.
test_steps: Step 1: Log in as 'user1@example.com' and create a new task
Step 2: Log out from the system
Step 3: Log in as 'user2@example.com'
Step 4: Attempt to navigate to '/tasks/user1_task_id'
Step 5: Verify that user2 cannot access or view tasks created by user1
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User2 is unable to see any task created by user1, confirming task visibility restrictions.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Task persistence and retrieval with MySQL integration
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that tasks created by a user are stored in the database and can be retrieved upon subsequent logins.
test_steps: Step 1: Log in as 'user@example.com'
Step 2: Create a new task named 'Integration Test Task' with description 'This is an integration test.'
Step 3: Log out and log back in to the system
Step 4: Navigate to '/tasks/user_task_id'
Step 5: Verify that the created task appears on the user's dashboard
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User can view their previously created tasks upon logging back in, confirming proper task persistence and retrieval from MySQL.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Filter tasks by status 'Completed'
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the user can filter tasks by status to show only completed tasks.
preconditions: Multiple tasks with different statuses exist
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to task management page at /tasks
Step 2: Click 'Filter' button
Step 3: Select status filter option as 'Completed'
Step 4: Click 'Apply Filter' button
Step 5: Verify that only tasks with status 'Completed' are displayed
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The task list is updated to display only tasks with the status 'Completed'.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Filter tasks by invalid status value
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system does not allow filtering with an invalid status value.
preconditions: Multiple tasks with different statuses exist
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to task management page at /tasks
Step 2: Click 'Filter' button
Step 3: Enter invalid status filter option as 'InvalidStatus'
Step 4: Click 'Apply Filter' button
Step 5: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating the invalid status value
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An error message is shown stating that 'InvalidStatus' is not a valid task status.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Filter tasks by minimum number of results
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system displays exactly one task when filtering with a status and only one matching task exists.
preconditions: Exactly one task with specific status
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to task management page at /tasks
Step 2: Click 'Filter' button
Step 3: Select status filter option as 'In Progress'
Step 4: Click 'Apply Filter' button
Step 5: Verify that exactly one task with the status 'In Progress' is displayed
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The system displays exactly one task with the status 'In Progress'.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Filter tasks and integrate with notification system
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that filtering tasks by status triggers a notification for the user.
preconditions: Multiple tasks with different statuses exist
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to task management page at /tasks
Step 2: Click 'Filter' button
Step 3: Select status filter option as 'Pending'
Step 4: Click 'Apply Filter' button
Step 5: Verify that a notification is received indicating the number of pending tasks
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: A system notification is sent to the user with details about the filtered pending tasks.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration with hashed password using passport
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that a new user can register and their password is correctly hashed by the system.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register page
Step 2: Enter email 'newuser@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass456' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Register' button
Step 5: Verify a success message is displayed confirming registration
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully registered and system logs the user's hashed password in the database.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Invalid registration with weak password using passport
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system prevents registration with a weak password and provides an appropriate error message.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register page
Step 2: Enter email 'weakuser@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password 'abc123' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Register' button
Step 5: Verify an error message is displayed indicating the password is too weak
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Registration fails and system displays a specific error message stating that the password must meet complexity requirements.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Registration with maximum allowed characters in password using passport
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system allows registration with a password of exactly the maximum allowed length.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register page
Step 2: Enter email 'maxuser@example.com' in email field
Step 3: Enter password with exactly 72 characters (e.g., 'AaBbCcDdEeFfGgHhIiJjKkLlMmNnOoPpQqRrSsTtUuVvWwXxYyZz123456') in password field
Step 4: Click 'Register' button
Step 5: Verify a success message is displayed confirming registration
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully registered with a password of exactly the maximum allowed length, and system logs the hashed password in the database.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: User registration with passport integration for email validation using external service
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system integrates with an external email validation service to ensure the provided email is valid during user registration.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /register page
Step 2: Enter email 'invaliduser@example.com' in email field (an invalid domain)
Step 3: Enter password 'SecurePass789' in password field
Step 4: Click 'Register' button
Step 5: Verify an error message is displayed indicating the email address is invalid
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Registration fails and system displays a specific error message stating that the provided email address could not be validated by the external service.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system responsiveness on mobile devices using Bootstrap
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the task management application is responsive and displays correctly on a mobile device.
preconditions: User has access to a mobile device with a screen resolution of 360x740
Browser window resized to mobile dimensions
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the home page at /home
Step 2: Resize browser window to emulate a mobile device (width: 360px, height: 740px)
Step 3: Scroll down and up on the page to ensure all elements are visible and responsive
Step 4: Verify that all navigation buttons and links are clickable and functional
Step 5: Confirm that text is readable and images do not exceed screen width
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All UI elements on the home page should be fully visible, responsive, and functional when viewed on a mobile device with a resolution of 360x740.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system responsiveness on mobile devices with incorrect Bootstrap configuration
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the task management application does not break when an incorrect Bootstrap version is used.
preconditions: Bootstrap version incorrectly configured to a non-responsive version
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the home page at /home
Step 2: Resize browser window to emulate a mobile device (width: 360px, height: 740px)
Step 3: Scroll down and up on the page to ensure all elements are visible and responsive
Step 4: Verify that navigation buttons and links are not clickable or functional due to incorrect Bootstrap configuration
Step 5: Confirm that text is unreadable and images exceed screen width
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message indicating that the current Bootstrap version does not support mobile responsiveness, and navigation elements are non-functional.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system responsiveness on the smallest supported screen resolution for mobile devices
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the task management application is responsive and displays correctly at the minimum supported screen resolution.
preconditions: Browser window resized to the smallest supported mobile dimensions
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the home page at /home
Step 2: Resize browser window to emulate a mobile device with the smallest supported screen resolution (width: 320px, height: 480px)
Step 3: Scroll down and up on the page to ensure all elements are visible and responsive
Step 4: Verify that navigation buttons and links are clickable and functional at this minimum resolution
Step 5: Confirm that text is readable and images do not exceed screen width
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All UI elements on the home page should be fully visible, responsive, and functional when viewed on a mobile device with the smallest supported screen resolution of 320x480.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system responsiveness on mobile devices with integration of task management features
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the task management application is responsive and integrates correctly with other features when viewed on a mobile device.
preconditions: User has access to a mobile device
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the home page at /home
Step 2: Resize browser window to emulate a mobile device (width: 360px, height: 740px)
Step 3: Click on 'Add Task' button and enter task details in the form fields
Step 4: Verify that the new task is added successfully and displayed correctly on the home page
Step 5: Confirm that all other navigation buttons and links are clickable and functional
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The system should allow users to add tasks via a mobile device, display them correctly on the home page, and ensure that all navigation elements remain responsive and functional.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify straightforward user interface for task management
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system's user interface is clear and easy to use by verifying key elements are present and functional.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the main dashboard at /dashboard
Step 2: Verify presence of 'Add Task' button on top right corner
Step 3: Click 'Add Task' button and verify task creation form appears
Step 4: Enter task name 'Test Task' in task name field
Step 5: Select due date as today's date from calendar picker
Step 6: Click 'Save' button to create the task
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Task named 'Test Task' is successfully created with due date set for today and displayed in the tasks list.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify error handling on task creation with invalid data
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure the system provides clear feedback when attempting to create a task with missing mandatory fields.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the main dashboard at /dashboard
Step 2: Click 'Add Task' button and verify task creation form appears
Step 3: Leave all fields blank except for due date, set as today's date from calendar picker
Step 4: Click 'Save' button without entering any other details
Step 5: Verify error message 'Task name is required' displayed next to the task name field
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An error message stating 'Task name is required' appears when attempting to save a task without entering any details.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify maximum number of tasks displayed on dashboard
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure the system displays a maximum of 100 tasks and provides pagination for more.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the main dashboard at /dashboard
Step 2: Verify that exactly 100 tasks are displayed on the first page
Step 3: Click 'Next' button and verify next set of tasks is loaded
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: The system displays a maximum of 100 tasks per page, with pagination available to view additional tasks beyond the initial limit.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify integration between task management and notification system
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the task creation process triggers a notification to remind the user of their new task.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the main dashboard at /dashboard
Step 2: Click 'Add Task' button and verify task creation form appears
Step 3: Enter task name 'Reminder Task' in task name field
Step 4: Set due date as tomorrow's date from calendar picker
Step 5: Click 'Save' button to create the task
Step 6: Verify a notification is received reminding of the new task
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Upon creating a task with a due date set for tomorrow, a reminder notification is sent to the user's account.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify navigation to task management page from dashboard
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the user can navigate to the task management page from the dashboard.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /dashboard URL
Step 2: Click 'Task Management' link on the navigation bar
Step 3: Verify that the user is redirected to /task-management URL
Step 4: Confirm that the page title contains 'Task Management'
Step 5: Check if all task management features are present and functional
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully navigates from dashboard to task management page with correct URL and page title.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify error message when navigating to non-existent task management page
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that an appropriate error message is displayed when attempting to navigate to a non-existent task management page.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /dashboard URL
Step 2: Click on 'Task Management' link with incorrect URL '/task-management-nonexistent'
Step 3: Verify that the user remains on the dashboard page
Step 4: Confirm that an error message is displayed indicating the non-existent page
Step 5: Check if the error message provides a solution or guidance
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User stays on dashboard and receives an error message about the non-existent task management page.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify navigation behavior when multiple navigation links are present
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system correctly handles navigation with multiple active navigation links.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /dashboard URL
Step 2: Click on 'Task Management' link and verify redirection to /task-management
Step 3: Click back button or navigate to another page, then click 'Productivity Tools'
Step 4: Verify that the user is redirected to /productivity-tools
Step 5: Confirm that all navigation links function as expected without conflicts
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: User successfully navigates between multiple pages with correct redirection and no conflicting behavior.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify navigation integration with user authentication system
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the navigation system correctly integrates with the user authentication system.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to /dashboard URL as a logged-in user
Step 2: Click on 'Task Management' link and verify redirection to /task-management
Step 3: Log out the user by clicking 'Logout'
Step 4: Verify that navigation links are no longer visible or redirect to login page
Step 5: Confirm that authentication status affects navigation behavior as expected
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Navigation system correctly integrates with user authentication, hiding links and redirecting based on login status.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System maintains 99% uptime during peak hours
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system remains operational and responsive during high traffic periods.
test_steps: Step 1: Start monitoring system performance at /status endpoint
Step 2: Simulate 50 simultaneous users accessing the system
Step 3: Verify that all requests are processed within 2 seconds
Step 4: Check system uptime percentage over a 24-hour period
Step 5: Confirm no downtime or service interruptions during peak hours
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: System maintains an uptime of at least 99% with all requests processed within the specified time limit

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles unexpected downtime gracefully during maintenance
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system provides appropriate error messages and redirects when experiencing planned or unplanned outages.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to any page on the application
Step 2: Verify display of maintenance message 'System Maintenance in Progress'
Step 3: Attempt to perform an action that requires system access
Step 4: Confirm redirection to a maintenance status page with contact information
Step 5: Check for inclusion of estimated downtime duration and resolution timeline
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Users are redirected to a maintenance page with clear communication about the outage status and expected recovery time

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles exactly 99% uptime during a specific period
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system can achieve and maintain exactly 99% uptime over a defined testing window.
preconditions: Set up monitoring for uptime percentage
test_steps: Step 1: Begin monitoring system performance at /status endpoint
Step 2: Simulate fluctuating user traffic patterns throughout the day
Step 3: Verify that system uptime is maintained at exactly 99% over a 24-hour period
Step 4: Check for any service interruptions or delays during low-traffic periods
Step 5: Confirm no downtime occurs outside of scheduled maintenance windows
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: System maintains an uptime of exactly 99% over the specified testing period with no unexpected service interruptions

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System uptime monitoring integrates with alerting system during outages
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system sends alerts to administrators when uptime falls below the specified threshold.
test_steps: Step 1: Simulate an unexpected system outage causing downtime
Step 2: Verify that an alert is sent to admin email 'admin@example.com'
Step 3: Check the content of the alert for details about the outage
Step 4: Confirm that the alert includes a suggested recovery action plan
Step 5: Ensure that the system resumes normal operation after resolving the issue
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: An alert is sent to the designated admin email with detailed information about the outage and a suggested recovery plan

test_data.alert_content: System Uptime Alert - Downtime detected, please investigate.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system functionality on Chrome browser
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system functions correctly when accessed through Google Chrome.
test_steps: Step 1: Open Google Chrome browser at URL 'https://example.com'
Step 2: Navigate to the home page
Step 3: Click on the 'Tasks' tab
Step 4: Verify that all task management features are fully functional and responsive
Step 5: Confirm that no errors or warnings appear in the browser console
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All task management features function correctly without any errors or warnings in Chrome browser.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system functionality on outdated Chrome version
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system does not function correctly when accessed through an outdated version of Google Chrome.
test_steps: Step 1: Open outdated Google Chrome browser at URL 'https://example.com'
Step 2: Navigate to the home page
Step 3: Click on the 'Tasks' tab
Step 4: Verify that task management features are not fully functional due to outdated browser version
Step 5: Confirm that an error message is displayed indicating the need for a newer browser
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Task management features do not function correctly and display an error message for users with outdated Chrome versions.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: Verify system functionality on minimum supported Chrome version
phase1_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system functions correctly when accessed through the minimum supported version of Google Chrome.
test_steps: Step 1: Open minimum supported Google Chrome browser at URL 'https://example.com'
Step 2: Navigate to the home page
Step 3: Click on the 'Tasks' tab
Step 4: Verify that all task management features are fully functional and responsive
Step 5: Confirm that no errors or warnings appear in the browser console
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All task management features function correctly without any errors or warnings when accessed through the minimum supported Chrome version.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles up to 100 concurrent users with task operations CRUD successfully
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system can handle up to 100 concurrent users performing CRUD operations on tasks without performance degradation.
test_steps: Step 1: Simulate login for 100 different users using their unique credentials
Step 2: Each user creates a new task with specific details (title, description)
Step 3: After creation, each user updates the title of their created task
Step 4: Verify that all tasks are successfully updated in the system database
Step 5: Simulate logout for all users and ensure no performance issues arise
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All 100 users successfully perform CRUD operations on their tasks without any system performance degradation or errors.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles invalid task creation attempts from concurrent users
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system correctly rejects invalid task creations by concurrent users and logs appropriate error messages.
test_steps: Step 1: Simulate login for 100 different users using their unique credentials
Step 2: Each user attempts to create a task with missing mandatory fields (title)
Step 3: Verify that the system rejects all invalid task creation requests
Step 4: Ensure error messages are logged and returned to each user indicating failure
Step 5: Simulate logout for all users and ensure no performance issues arise
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All invalid task creation attempts are rejected with appropriate error messages logged, ensuring system integrity.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles exactly 100 concurrent users performing CRUD operations on tasks
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system can handle exactly 100 concurrent users performing CRUD operations without performance issues.
test_steps: Step 1: Simulate login for exactly 100 different users using their unique credentials
Step 2: Each user creates a new task with specific details (title, description)
Step 3: After creation, each user updates the title of their created task
Step 4: Verify that all tasks are successfully updated in the system database without performance issues
Step 5: Simulate logout for all users and ensure no performance issues arise
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: Exactly 100 concurrent users successfully perform CRUD operations on their tasks without any system performance degradation or errors.

phase1_test_cases.test_title: System handles concurrent user task operations with integrated authentication service
phase1_test_cases.description: Verify that the system can handle up to 100 concurrent users performing CRUD operations on tasks while integrating with an external authentication service.
preconditions: Ensure backend service and authentication service are running
test_steps: Step 1: Simulate login for 100 different users using their unique credentials through the integrated authentication service
Step 2: Each user creates a new task with specific details (title, description)
Step 3: After creation, each user updates the title of their created task
Step 4: Verify that all tasks are successfully updated in the system database without performance issues
Step 5: Simulate logout for all users and ensure no performance issues arise
phase1_test_cases.expected_result: All 100 concurrent users successfully perform CRUD operations on their tasks while integrating with the external authentication service without any system performance degradation or errors.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Performance Test: New User Registration under Load
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate the system's ability to handle concurrent new user registrations and ensure response times remain within acceptable limits.
preconditions: System is up and running with all services available
Database is initialized and ready for test data
Load testing tool (e.g., JMeter) is configured with appropriate settings
test_steps: Step 1: Configure the load testing tool to simulate concurrent user registrations, starting with a low number of users (50)
Step 2: Send POST requests to /api/register for each simulated user, including unique usernames and valid passwords
Step 3: Monitor response times for all registration requests and ensure they do not exceed 1 second per request
Step 4: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users by increments of 50 until reaching a maximum of 500 users
Step 5: Verify that the system can handle up to 500 simultaneous registrations without failing or significantly degrading performance
Step 6: Record and analyze response times for each increment, ensuring they remain below 1.5 seconds throughout the test
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should be able to handle up to 500 concurrent user registrations with response times remaining below 1.5 seconds for all requests.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Performance Test: User Registration Response Time under Stress
phase2_test_cases.description: Evaluate the system's response time when handling a large number of user registration requests in a short period.
preconditions: System is up and running with all services available
Database is initialized and ready for test data
Load testing tool (e.g., JMeter) is configured to simulate rapid-fire registrations
test_steps: Step 1: Configure the load testing tool to send a burst of registration requests, starting with 50 users in under 3 seconds
Step 2: Send POST requests to /api/register for each user, including unique usernames and valid passwords
Step 3: Monitor response times for all registration requests during the initial burst and ensure they do not exceed 1 second per request
Step 4: Gradually increase the number of users in the burst by increments of 50 until reaching a maximum of 200 users
Step 5: Verify that the system can handle up to 200 simultaneous registrations during bursts without failing or significantly degrading performance
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should be able to handle up to 200 simultaneous user registrations during a burst of requests with response times remaining below 1.5 seconds for all requests.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Performance Test: User Registration System Scalability
phase2_test_cases.description: Test the scalability of the user registration system by gradually increasing the number of concurrent users over time.
preconditions: System is up and running with all services available
Database is initialized and ready for test data
Load testing tool (e.g., JMeter) is configured to simulate gradual increases in user registrations
test_steps: Step 1: Configure the load testing tool to start with a low number of concurrent users (50)
Step 2: Send POST requests to /api/register for each user, including unique usernames and valid passwords
Step  3: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users by increments of 50 every minute until reaching a maximum of 1000 users
Step 4: Monitor response times for all registration requests during the gradual increase and ensure they do not exceed 2 seconds per request
Step 5: Verify that the system can handle up to 1000 simultaneous registrations without failing or significantly degrading performance
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should be able to handle up to 1000 simultaneous user registrations with response times remaining below 2 seconds for all requests during the gradual increase.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Prevent registration with weak passwords
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that users cannot register with a username and an insecure password.
preconditions: System has defined criteria for strong passwords
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the user registration page via URL /register in browser
Step 2: Enter a valid username 'testuser' into the Username field
Step 3: Enter an insecure password 'password123' into the Password field
Step 4: Click on the Register button
Step 5: Verify that the system displays an error message indicating that the password is too weak
Step 6: Ensure no user account is created with this username and password combination
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Password must contain at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, a number, and a special character.' No user account is created.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Prevent registration with common usernames
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that users cannot register with a username that is commonly used and potentially indicative of automated bots or malicious actors.
preconditions: System maintains a list of common usernames
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the user registration page via URL /register in browser
Step 2: Enter a common username 'admin' into the Username field
Step 3: Enter a strong password 'P@ssw0rd!' into the Password field
Step 4: Click on the Register button
Step 5: Verify that the system displays an error message indicating that the username is not allowed
Step 6: Ensure no user account is created with this username
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Username 'admin' is not allowed. Please choose a different username.' No user account is created.
phase2_test_cases.srs_section: 4.6 User Registration Security - Common Username Restrictions

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Prevent registration with duplicate usernames
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that users cannot register with a username that is already in use by another user.
preconditions: System checks for existing usernames during registration
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the user registration page via URL /register in browser
Step 2: Enter an existing username 'existinguser' into the Username field
Step 3: Enter a strong password 'P@ssw0rd!' into the Password field
Step 4: Click on the Register button
Step 5: Verify that the system displays an error message indicating that the username is already taken
Step 6: Ensure no user account is created with this duplicate username
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Username 'existinguser' is already taken. Please choose a different username.' No user account is created.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: New user registration using a unique username on desktop
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate the process of new user registration through the desktop interface, ensuring clarity and ease of use.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the homepage and locate the 'Sign Up' button
Step 2: Click on the 'Sign Up' button to open the registration form page
Step 3: Enter a unique username (e.g., 'newuser123') in the designated field
Step 4: Verify that the username is accepted and no error message appears
Step 5: Click on the 'Next' or 'Continue' button to proceed to the next step of registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should accept the unique username without any error messages, and the user should be able to proceed to the next stage of registration.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: New user registration using a unique username on mobile
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate the process of new user registration through the mobile interface, ensuring clarity and ease of use.
test_steps: Step 1: Open the application's homepage and locate the 'Sign Up' button
Step 2: Tap on the 'Sign Up' button to open the registration form page
Step 3: Enter a unique username (e.g., 'newuser456') in the designated field
Step 4: Verify that the username is accepted and no error message appears
Step 5: Tap on the 'Next' or 'Continue' button to proceed to the next step of registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should accept the unique username without any error messages, and the user should be able to proceed to the next stage of registration.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: New user registration using an already existing username on desktop
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate the system's response when a new user attempts to register with an already used username.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the homepage and locate the 'Sign Up' button
Step 2: Click on the 'Sign Up' button to open the registration form page
Step 3: Enter an existing username (e.g., 'existinguser') in the designated field
Step 4: Verify that the system displays a clear error message indicating that the username is already taken
Step 5: Attempt to proceed by clicking on the 'Next' or 'Continue' button and verify that no further action is possible until the issue is resolved
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display a clear error message indicating that the username is already taken, preventing the user from proceeding to the next stage of registration.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: User Registration on iOS Device
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that a new user can register by providing a username on an iOS device.
preconditions: iOS device with the latest version of the app installed
test_steps: Step 1: Open the application on an iPhone running iOS 15.0 or later
Step 2: Navigate to the 'Register' page by tapping the 'Sign Up' button from the login screen
Step 3: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field, ensuring it is unique and within the allowed character limit (e.g., between 5 and 20 characters)
Step 4: Tap the 'Register' button to submit the registration form
Step 5: Verify that the user is redirected to the 'Welcome' page with a success message indicating successful registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application should successfully register the new user and display a welcome message on the screen, confirming that the username is unique and within the specified character limit.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: User Registration on Android Device with Different Screen Sizes
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that a new user can register by providing a username across various screen sizes and resolutions on an Android device.
preconditions: Android device running version 10 or later
test_steps: Step 1: Open the application on an Android phone with a small screen (e.g., Samsung Galaxy A21s)
Step 2: Navigate to the 'Register' page by tapping the 'Sign Up' button from the login screen
Step 3: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field, ensuring it is unique and within the allowed character limit (e.g., between 5 and 20 characters)
Step 4: Tap the 'Register' button to submit the registration form
Step 5: Verify that the user is redirected to the 'Welcome' page with a success message indicating successful registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application should successfully register the new user and display a welcome message on the screen, confirming that the username is unique and within the specified character limit, regardless of the device's screen size or resolution.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Web-Based User Registration Across Browsers
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that a new user can register by providing a username across different web browsers.
preconditions: Latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
test_steps: Step 1: Open the application's website in Google Chrome on a desktop computer
Step 2: Navigate to the 'Register' page by clicking the 'Sign Up' button from the login screen
Step 3: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field, ensuring it is unique and within the allowed character limit (e.g., between 5 and 20 characters)
Step 4: Click the 'Register' button to submit the registration form
Step 5: Verify that the user is redirected to the 'Welcome' page with a success message indicating successful registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application should successfully register the new user and display a welcome message on the screen, confirming that the username is unique and within the specified character limit, regardless of the web browser used.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: New user registration with valid username
phase2_test_cases.description: Validates the system's ability to register a new user by providing a unique username.
preconditions: User does not exist in the database
test_steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/register with header Authorization: Bearer <valid_jwt_token>
Step 2: Include request body: {"username": "newuser", "password": "securePassword123!"}
Step 3: Verify HTTP 201 status code returned
Step 4: Verify response body contains user ID and token
Step 5: Verify the new user appears in GET /api/users response with the correct username
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should return HTTP 201 status code and include a unique user ID and token in the response body. The newly registered user must be retrievable via GET /api/users with the correct username.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Registration fails for duplicate usernames
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensures that attempting to register a user with an already existing username results in an error.
test_steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/register with header Authorization: Bearer <valid_jwt_token>
Step 2: Include request body: {"username": "existinguser", "password": "securePassword123!"}
Step 3: Verify HTTP 409 status code returned
Step 4: Verify response body contains error message indicating username already exists
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should return HTTP 409 status code and include an error message in the response body indicating that the username is already taken.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Registration with invalid characters in username
phase2_test_cases.description: Verifies that registration fails when an invalid character is included in the username.
test_steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/register with header Authorization: Bearer <valid_jwt_token>
Step 2: Include request body: {"username": "invalid#user", "password": "securePassword123!"}
Step 3: Verify HTTP 400 status code returned
Step 4: Verify response body contains error message indicating invalid characters in username
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should return HTTP 400 status code and include an error message in the response body indicating that invalid characters are not allowed in the username.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Ensure username uniqueness during user registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the system prevents duplicate usernames upon new user registration.
preconditions: A valid JWT token for an admin user
At least one existing user with a specific username
test_steps: Step 1: Log in as an admin user and navigate to the 'New User Registration' page
Step 2: Enter an already registered username ('existingUser') in the 'Username' field and leave other fields blank or default
Step 3: Click on the 'Register' button
Step 4: Verify that a validation error message is displayed next to the 'Username' field indicating that the username is already taken
Step 5: Attempt to register with another unique username ('newUser') and ensure registration succeeds without any errors
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display a validation error message indicating that the entered username is already in use, preventing duplicate registrations. The unique username registration must succeed with no errors.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Validate mandatory fields during user registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system enforces mandatory field validation for new user registrations.
preconditions: A valid JWT token for an admin user
test_steps: Step 1: Log in as an admin user and navigate to the 'New User Registration' page
Step 2: Leave all fields except the 'Username' field blank or with default values, ensuring that mandatory fields are not filled out
Step 3: Click on the 'Register' button
Step 4: Verify that validation error messages appear next to each mandatory field indicating that they must be filled in
Step 5: Fill in all mandatory fields and leave optional fields blank or with default values, then click 'Register'. Ensure registration succeeds without any errors
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display validation error messages for each mandatory field that is left blank or not filled out correctly, preventing the registration process from completing. Upon filling in all mandatory fields and leaving optional fields as default, the registration must succeed without any errors.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Ensure data type constraints are enforced during user registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the system enforces proper data type constraints for fields such as username and email.
preconditions: A valid JWT token for an admin user
test_steps: Step 1: Log in as an admin user and navigate to the 'New User Registration' page
Step 2: Enter a username with special characters ('!@#') in the 'Username' field
Step 3: Click on the 'Register' button
Step 4: Verify that a validation error message is displayed next to the 'Username' field indicating that it must be alphanumeric only
Step 5: Enter an email address with invalid format ('invalidemail') in the 'Email' field and click 'Register'
Step 6: Verify that a validation error message appears next to the 'Email' field indicating that it must follow standard email format
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display validation error messages for both invalid username and email formats, preventing registration with improperly formatted data. The error messages must specify that the 'Username' field must be alphanumeric only and the 'Email' field must follow standard email format.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Network Interruption Handling During User Registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the system can recover from network interruptions during user registration and complete the process successfully.
preconditions: System is connected to internet initially
test_steps: Step 1: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field
Step 2: Simulate network interruption by disconnecting from internet
Step 3: Click on the 'Register' button while disconnected
Step 4: Reconnect to the internet and wait for system recovery
Step 5: Verify that registration process resumes automatically
Step 6: Confirm successful completion of user registration
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display a message indicating network recovery and continue the registration process, resulting in a new user account being created with the provided username.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: App Crash Recovery During User Registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that the system can recover from an app crash during user registration and continue the process.
test_steps: Step 1: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field
Step 2: Simulate app crash by force stopping the application
Step 3: Restart the application and navigate back to the registration page
Step 4: Verify that entered information is preserved and registration can be resumed
Step 5: Complete the registration process successfully
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should retain the previously entered username and allow the user to complete the registration process without needing to re-enter information.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Session Timeout Handling During User Registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the system handles session timeouts gracefully during user registration and allows for continuation of the process.
test_steps: Step 1: Enter a valid username in the 'Username' field
Step 2: Wait until session timeout occurs (e.g., after 30 minutes of inactivity)
Step 3: Verify that the system prompts for re-authentication or automatically extends the session
Step 4: Complete any necessary authentication steps to regain access
Step 5: Continue and complete the registration process
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should either prompt for re-authentication or automatically extend the session, allowing the user to continue with the registration process without losing entered information.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Username registration with minimum character limit
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that the system allows a new user to register using a username with the exact minimum number of characters.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page via the URL /register
Step 2: Enter 'a' as the value for the username field (minimum allowed length)
Step 3: Leave other required fields such as password and email empty or with default values if applicable
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form
Step 5: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating a valid username must be at least one character longer than entered
Step 6: Attempt registration again with a username of exactly two characters to ensure minimum limit acceptance
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message indicating that the username must be at least two characters long when attempting registration with a single character.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Username registration with maximum character limit
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that the system allows a new user to register using a username up to the exact maximum number of characters.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page via the URL /register
Step 2: Enter 'a9999' as the value for the username field (maximum allowed length)
Step 3: Leave other required fields such as password and email empty or with default values if applicable
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form
Step 5: Verify that registration is successful without any errors indicating a valid username must be shorter than entered
Step 6: Attempt registration again with a username of exactly five characters plus one to ensure maximum limit rejection
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should allow the user to register successfully when entering a username that is exactly five characters long but reject any longer usernames.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Username registration with special character boundary conditions
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that the system allows a new user to register using a username containing allowed special characters but rejects invalid ones.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page via the URL /register
Step 2: Enter 'user@name' as the value for the username field (contains allowed special character '@')
Step 3: Leave other required fields such as password and email empty or with default values if applicable
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form
Step 5: Verify that registration is successful without any errors indicating invalid characters
Step 6: Attempt registration again with a username of '!user@name' (contains disallowed special character '!') and verify rejection
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should allow the user to register successfully when entering a username that contains allowed special characters but reject any usernames with disallowed special characters.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Handle username already exists error during registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the system returns an appropriate error message when a user attempts to register with an existing username.
preconditions: A user has successfully registered and is logged in.
The same user tries to register again using their own username.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page of the application.
Step 2: Enter a valid email address, password, and confirm password fields with actual values.
Step 3: In the 'Username' field, enter an existing user's username (e.g., 'john_doe').
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form.
Step 5: Verify that a specific error message is displayed indicating that the username already exists.
Step 6: Ensure that no new account has been created in the system.
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Username already exists. Please choose a different username.' and prevent the creation of a new account.
phase2_test_cases.srs_section: User Registration - Error Handling for Existing Usernames

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Handle empty username during registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the system returns an appropriate error message when a user attempts to register with an empty or null value in the username field.
preconditions: Navigate to the registration page of the application.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page and ensure all fields are clear.
Step 2: Enter a valid email address, password, and confirm password with actual values.
Step 3: Leave the 'Username' field empty or enter null value.
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form.
Step 5: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating that the username cannot be empty.
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Username cannot be empty. Please enter a valid username.' and prevent the registration process from proceeding.
phase2_test_cases.srs_section: User Registration - Error Handling for Empty Username

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Handle invalid characters in username during registration
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the system returns an appropriate error message when a user attempts to register with a username containing special or invalid characters.
preconditions: Navigate to the registration page of the application.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page and ensure all fields are clear.
Step 2: Enter a valid email address, password, and confirm password with actual values.
Step 3: In the 'Username' field, enter a username containing special characters (e.g., '!@#$%^&*()').
Step 4: Click on the 'Register' button to submit the form.
Step 5: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating that the username contains invalid characters.
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message stating 'Username contains invalid characters. Please use only letters, numbers, and underscores.' and prevent the registration process from proceeding.
phase2_test_cases.srs_section: User Registration - Error Handling for Invalid Characters in Username

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify secure password storage and validation upon account creation
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system enforces strong password policies, stores passwords securely using hashing algorithms, and validates user input to prevent SQL injection or other vulnerabilities.
preconditions: System is configured with a security policy requiring minimum 8 characters including at least one number
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the account creation form
Step 2: Enter username 'testuser' and email 'test@example.com'
Step 3: Attempt to create an account using password 'password' (less than 8 characters)
Step 4: Verify that the system displays a validation error message indicating that the password must be at least 8 characters long
Step 5: Enter username 'secureuser', email 'secure@example.com', and password 'P@ssw0rd123!' (meets complexity requirements)
Step 6: Submit the form and verify that a success message is displayed, indicating account creation was successful
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display an error message when a weak password is entered and successfully create the account with a strong password, storing it securely.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Prevent unauthorized access to user accounts through brute force attacks
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system implements rate limiting or account lockout mechanisms after multiple failed login attempts.
preconditions: System is configured with a security policy allowing 5 failed login attempts before locking the account
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the user login form
Step 2: Enter username 'testuser' and incorrect password 'wrongpass'
Step 3: Click on the 'Login' button (repeat this step four more times for a total of five failed attempts)
Step 4: Verify that after the fifth failed attempt, an account lockout message is displayed
Step 5: Wait for the system-defined unlock period to expire and try logging in with correct credentials
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: After five consecutive failed login attempts, the system should display an account lockout message and prevent further logins until the unlock period has passed.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Ensure secure transmission of sensitive information during account creation
phase2_test_cases.description: Verify that all data transmitted between the client and server is encrypted using HTTPS to prevent interception or eavesdropping.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the account creation form
Step 2: Enter username 'secureuser', email 'secure@example.com', and password 'P@ssw0rd123!'
Step 3: Observe network traffic during submission of registration form using a packet analyzer tool like Wireshark
Step 4: Verify that all data transmitted is encrypted with HTTPS protocol
Step 5: Confirm that the URL in the browser address bar starts with 'https://' and not 'http://'
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: All data transmitted during account creation should be encrypted using HTTPS, and the URL in the browser address bar must start with 'https://'.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: User creates a new account through the registration form
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that users can successfully create an account following the provided workflow.
preconditions: User is on the registration page
All required fields are visible and correctly labeled
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page by clicking 'Sign Up' from the homepage
Step 2: Enter a valid email address in the 'Email Address' field
Step 3: Create a password that meets complexity requirements (minimum 8 characters, including uppercase and special characters) in the 'Password' field
Step 4: Confirm the password by re-entering it in the 'Confirm Password' field
Step 5: Click the 'Create Account' button to submit the form
Step 6: Verify that a success message is displayed indicating account creation
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user receives a confirmation email within 5 minutes and sees a success message on the screen stating 'Your account has been created successfully'. The new user's account should be active in the system.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify error messages when creating an invalid account
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that users receive clear and informative error messages when attempting to create an invalid account.
preconditions: User is on the registration page
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the registration page by clicking 'Sign Up' from the homepage
Step 2: Enter an email address without a domain in the 'Email Address' field
Step 3: Create a password that does not meet complexity requirements (less than 8 characters) in the 'Password' field
Step 4: Confirm the password by re-entering it in the 'Confirm Password' field
Step 5: Click the 'Create Account' button to submit the form
Step 6: Verify that error messages are displayed next to each invalid input field
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: Error messages appear under the 'Email Address' and 'Password' fields indicating that the email is invalid and the password does not meet complexity requirements. The form remains filled with previously entered data.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Validate account creation process on mobile devices
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the account creation process is fully functional and user-friendly on mobile devices.
preconditions: User has a smartphone with internet access
Mobile browser or app is open
test_steps: Step 1: Open the registration page from a mobile device's web browser
Step 2: Enter a valid email address in the 'Email Address' field using on-screen keyboard
Step 3: Create a password that meets complexity requirements (minimum 8 characters, including uppercase and special characters) in the 'Password' field
Step 4: Confirm the password by re-entering it in the 'Confirm Password' field
Step 5: Click the 'Create Account' button to submit the form using mobile device's touch screen
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user sees a success message on the mobile device's screen stating 'Your account has been created successfully'. The registration form is fully responsive and all fields are easily accessible via touch input.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Account creation process on iOS and Android devices
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate the account creation process to ensure consistency across different mobile platforms.
preconditions: User has access to both an iOS device and an Android device
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the sign-up page on the iOS app
Step 2: Enter a valid email address in the 'Email' field, ensuring it is unique and follows domain-specific rules (e.g., @example.com)
Step 3: Input a strong password that meets complexity requirements (minimum 8 characters including uppercase, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters) in the 'Password' field
Step 4: Confirm the password by re-entering it in the 'Confirm Password' field on both devices
Step 5: Click the 'Sign Up' button to initiate account creation process
Step 6: Verify that a confirmation email is received and contains an activation link
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The account creation process should successfully complete on both iOS and Android devices, resulting in the display of a confirmation message indicating successful registration.

test_data.password_strength: Minimum 8 characters with complexity requirements met
test_data.confirmation_link: Activation link sent to user's email

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Screen size and resolution impact on account creation UI elements
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the account creation form is fully functional and visually consistent across various screen sizes and resolutions.
preconditions: Access to multiple devices with different screen sizes and resolutions
test_steps: Step 1: Open the sign-up page on a device with a small screen (e.g., iPhone SE)
Step 2: Verify that all input fields are fully visible without requiring horizontal scrolling
Step 3: Switch to a larger device (e.g., iPad Pro) and repeat Step 2
Step 4: On both devices, enter valid data into the 'Email' and 'Password' fields as per complexity requirements
Step 5: Click on the 'Sign Up' button and confirm that no layout issues prevent successful account creation
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The sign-up form should be fully functional and visually consistent across all tested screen sizes, ensuring that no layout issues prevent the user from successfully creating an account.

test_data.password_strength: Minimum 8 characters with complexity requirements met

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Account creation process on different network types (WiFi, 4G, 5G)
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the account creation process functions correctly regardless of the type of internet connection.
preconditions: Access to devices with WiFi, 4G, and 5G connectivity
test_steps: Step 1: Connect a device to a WiFi network and navigate to the sign-up page
Step 2: Enter valid data into the 'Email' and 'Password' fields as per complexity requirements
Step 3: Click on the 'Sign Up' button and verify that account creation is successful within 5 seconds
Step 4: Repeat Steps 1-3 using a device connected to a 4G network
Step 5: Finally, repeat Steps 1-3 using a device connected to a 5G network
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The account creation process should successfully complete within 5 seconds on all tested network types, ensuring that the user experience is consistent regardless of internet connection.

test_data.password_strength: Minimum 8 characters with complexity requirements met

phase2_test_cases.test_title: User can create a new account via POST /api/users endpoint
phase2_test_cases.description: Validates that a user can successfully create an account by sending a POST request to the API with required fields.
preconditions: API server is up and running
No existing user with same email
test_steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/users with header Authorization: Bearer <valid_jwt_token>
Step 2: Include request body: {"email": "user@example.com", "password": "securePassword123!@#", "firstName": "John", "lastName": "Doe", "role": "USER"}
Step 3: Verify HTTP 201 status code returned
Step 4: Verify response body contains user object with auto-generated ID and email 'user@example.com'
Step 5: Verify response body includes 'createdAt' timestamp
Step 6: Attempt to send GET request to /api/users/user_id from step 3, verify HTTP 200 status code
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: A new user account is successfully created with HTTP 201 status code and a response body containing the newly created user's ID, email address, and creation timestamp.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify account deletion via DELETE /api/users/{user_id} endpoint
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensures that a user can be deleted from the system by sending a DELETE request to the API with the correct user ID.
preconditions: API server is up and running
test_steps: Step 1: Send GET request to /api/users/user_id to retrieve user data
Step 2: Extract 'user_id' from response body
Step 3: Send DELETE request to /api/users/{user_id} with header Authorization: Bearer <valid_jwt_token>
Step 4: Verify HTTP 204 status code returned
Step 5: Attempt GET request to /api/users/user_id, verify HTTP 404 status code
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The user with ID '1234567890' is successfully deleted from the system, and a subsequent GET request returns an HTTP 404 status code indicating that the resource does not exist.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Check for rate limiting on POST /api/users endpoint
phase2_test_cases.description: Validates that the API enforces a rate limit of 10 requests per minute to prevent abuse.
preconditions: API server is up and running
No existing user with same email
test_steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/users 10 times within one minute
Step 11: Verify that all requests return HTTP 201 status code
Step 12: Wait for exactly 60 seconds
Step 13: Send an additional POST request to /api/users
Step 14: Verify that this request returns HTTP 429 status code
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: After sending 10 POST requests within one minute, the API allows all of them to succeed with HTTP 201 status codes. However, an additional request immediately after the rate limit period results in an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests response.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Ensure mandatory fields are validated during account creation
phase2_test_cases.description: Validate that the system enforces data integrity by not allowing the creation of an account without required fields.
preconditions: User navigates to account creation page
All optional fields have default values or user input
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the 'Create Account' page
Step 2: Leave all mandatory fields (e.g., username, email) empty and submit the form
Step 3: Verify that an error message is displayed for each missing mandatory field
Step 4: Attempt to create an account without a valid email format by entering 'invalidemail'
Step 5: Confirm that an appropriate validation error message appears indicating the invalid email format
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should display specific error messages for each missing mandatory field and an invalid email format, preventing the account from being created.

test_data.expected_error_message: Please enter a valid email address.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Verify data type constraints during user profile update
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system enforces data type constraints for fields such as age (integer) and bio (string).
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the user's profile edit page
Step 2: Enter a non-numeric value (e.g., 'abc') in the age field and attempt to save changes
Step 3: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating that only numeric values are allowed for the age field
Step 4: Input a very long string (over 500 characters) into the bio text area and try saving
Step 5: Confirm that an error message appears stating that the bio must be less than or equal to 500 characters
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should prevent the saving of invalid data types and enforce character limits, displaying appropriate error messages for each constraint violation.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Check foreign key relationships when assigning tasks to users
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the system maintains data integrity by not allowing task assignments to non-existent or inactive users.
test_steps: Step 1: Navigate to the 'Assign Task' section of the task management interface
Step 2: Attempt to assign a new task to a user ID that does not exist in the system database
Step 3: Verify that an error message is displayed indicating that the selected user cannot be found
Step 4: Try assigning a task to an inactive or deleted user account
Step 5: Confirm that another error message appears stating that tasks can only be assigned to active users
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The system should prevent task assignments to non-existent or inactive users, displaying clear error messages for each invalid assignment attempt.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Network Interruption Handling During Account Creation
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the application can successfully recover and complete account creation after a network interruption.
preconditions: User navigates to account creation page
test_steps: Step 1: User starts filling out account creation form with valid credentials (username, email, password)
Step 2: Simulate network disconnection by disabling Wi-Fi or mobile data
Step 3: User attempts to submit the form while offline; UI should display a retry button and error message indicating network issues
Step 4: Re-enable network connection and click 'Retry' button on account creation page
Step 5: Verify that the application retries the submission and successfully creates the user account once the network is restored
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: The application should display a retry button and error message when network is disconnected. Upon re-establishing the connection, account creation should proceed successfully with no data loss.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: App Crash Recovery During Task Management Workflow
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure the application can recover from a crash and restore user's task management workflow.
preconditions: User logs in with an existing account
User navigates to task list page
test_steps: Step 1: User adds multiple tasks to their task list
Step 2: Simulate app crash by force stopping the application from device settings
Step 3: Re-launch the application and navigate back to the task list page
Step 4: Verify that all previously added tasks are still present in the task list without any data loss
phase2_test_cases.expected_result: Upon relaunching the application, all tasks created before the crash should be visible and intact on the task list page.

phase2_test_cases.test_title: Session Timeout Handling During Account Creation Process
phase2_test_cases.description: Ensure that the application properly handles session timeouts during account creation and allows users to resume their progress.
test_steps: Step 1: User begins filling out the account creation form with valid credentials
Step 2: Wait until the session times out (e.g., after 30 minutes of inactivity)
